Post-Match Reflections: India's head coach Vikram Rathour stated that it was disappointing to not get a game here.
Concerns regarding sustaining injuries on a wet outfield had to be considered, Rathour added.
On releasing two travelling reserves from the squad, Rathour said, 'That was always the plan. We wanted to keep two reserves, and release two.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was abandoned due to a wet outfield caused by a heavy downpour on the previous night.
India finished on top of the group, and will face Afghanistan in its first Super 8 fixture at Barbados on June 20.
Canada lost the chance to go up against the fan favourite side, and exited the tournament.
Others: Canada head coach Pubudu Dassanayake said, 'As an associate nation, we would have loved to play against the Indian team. But nature cannot be stopped. There was heavy rain in the last two days, so it was tough to get the ground ready.'
